Row.Text: Increases a city's [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and [ICON_FOOD] Food. Increases [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when constructing buildings by 10%. Only the Netherlands can build it.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must not be built on Hills.

The Dike is a Dutch unique replacement for the Windmill. In addition to yielding [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, the Dike also generates [ICON_FOOD] Food and has a second Engineer Specialist slot. Cities constructed on hills may not build Dikes.

A dike is an elongated naturally occurring ridge or artificially constructed fill or wall, which regulates water levels. It is usually earthen and often parallel to the course of a river in its floodplain or along low-lying coastlines. The modern word dike or dyke most likely derives from the Dutch word dijk, with the construction of dikes in Frisia (now part of the Netherlands and Germany) well attested as early as the 11th century. The 78-mile long Westfriese Omringdijk, completed by 1250, formed by connecting existing older dikes. The Roman chronicler Tacitus mentions that the rebellious Batavi pierced dikes to flood their land and to protect their retreat in AD 70. The word dijk originally indicated both the trench and the bank. It closely parallels the English verb to dig.
